answers.answer: Hi!If all the antibodies specific for lupus, Sjogren’s and RA are normal then other conditions which should be looked for are autoimmune hepatitis, scleroderma, polymyositis, autoimmune hemolytic anemia, dermatomyositis, primary biliary cirrhosis, Addison disease, Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), Hashimoto's Thyroiditis, mixed connective tissue disorders and type 1 diabetes mellitus. Please discuss with your doctor. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I have posted on a few forums over the past few years.  I have been sick for 3 yrs, quality of life has gone from a 10 to a 1.  I was diagnosed with a pancreatic neuro endocrine tumor 1.5 yrs ago, it was removed.  I got better for 4 months and then got worse again to the point of the beginning.Throughout my ANA has been high, going from 640, to320, back up to 640 during a flare of symptoms, and now during another flare it is up to 1280.  The pattern is diffused.All my other panels, Lupus, RA and Sjorgen's have been fine.  Rheumy told me it was a phenomenon, not to worry.I can see that if I wasn't sick.  But I am sick, and it is high.  It seems to spike when my symptoms spike...Any thoughts?  Thank you
title: ANA Pos, ruled a phenomenon yet keeps rising??
